info.name: Real-time Customer Profile API
info.description:
Real-time Customer Profile enables you to drive coordinated, consistent, and relvant experiences for your customers no matter where or when they interact with your brand. Profile provides a holistic view of each individual customer that combines data from multiple channels, including online, offline, CRM, and third-party data.

The Real-time Customer Profile API allows you to programatically integrate Profile's various functionalities into your service, providing RESTful endpoints for merge policy configuration, segmentation, edge projections, and more.

Related overview documentation:
  * [Real-time Customer Profile overview](https://www.adobe.io/apis/experienceplatform/home/profile-identity-segmentation/profile-identity-segmentation-services.html#!api-specification/markdown/narrative/technical_overview/unified_profile_architectural_overview/unified_profile_architectural_overview.md)
  * [Profile Query Language (PQL)](https://www.adobe.io/apis/experienceplatform/home/profile-identity-segmentation/profile-identity-segmentation-services.html#!api-specification/markdown/narrative/technical_overview/unified_profile_architectural_overview/unified_profile_pql.md)
  
Related tutorials:
  * [Configure Real-time Customer Profile using APIs](https://www.adobe.io/apis/experienceplatform/home/tutorials/alltutorials.html#!api-specification/markdown/narrative/tutorials/configuring_up_tutorial/configuring_up_tutorial.md)
  * [Access Real-time Customer Profile data using APIs](https://www.adobe.io/apis/experienceplatform/home/tutorials/alltutorials.html#!api-specification/markdown/narrative/tutorials/consuming_unified_profile_data/consuming_unified_profile_data.md)
  * [Work with merge policies using APIs](https://www.adobe.io/apis/experienceplatform/home/tutorials/alltutorials.html#!api-specification/markdown/narrative/tutorials/configuring_up_tutorial/configuring_merge_policies_tutorial.md)
  * [Create segments using APIs](https://www.adobe.io/apis/experienceplatform/home/tutorials/alltutorials.html#!api-specification/markdown/narrative/tutorials/creating_a_segment_tutorial/creating_a_segment_tutorial.md)

Notes:
  * PLATFORM Gateway URL: https://<span>platform.adobe.io/
  * Base path for this API: /data/core/ups
  * Example of a complete path: https://<span>platform.adobe.io/data/core/ups/config/mergePolicies
  * All service calls require the headers `Authorization`, `x-gw-ims-org-id`, and `x-api-key`. For more information on how to obtain these, visit the [authentication tutorial](https://www.adobe.io/apis/experienceplatform/home/tutorials/alltutorials.html#!api-specification/markdown/narrative/tutorials/authenticate_to_acp_tutorial/authenticate_to_acp_tutorial.md).

item.name: Merge policies
Retrieve a list of merge policies.
Create a new merge policy.
Lookup a merge policy by ID.
Update a merge policy by ID.
Update one or more attributes of a merge policy specified by ID.
Delete a merge policy by ID.

item.description: A merge policy is a set of configurations controlling aspects of identity stitching and data fragment merging. Merge policies are specific to a single schema, and can only be used to access entities adhering to that schema.

item.name: Entities
Lookup an entity by ID or namespace.
Lookup multiple entities by IDs or namespaces.
Delete an entity by ID.

item.description: Entities are Experience Data Model (XDM) objects whose attributes, data contents, and related time-series events have been merged from various sources by Real-time Customer Profile.

item.name: Export jobs
Retrieve a list of all export jobs.
Create a new export job.
Lookup an export job by ID.
Cancel or delete an export job by ID.

item.description: Export jobs are asynchronous processes that are used to persist audience segment members to datasets.

item.name: Segment definitions
Retrieve a list of segment definitions.
Create a new segment definition.
Lookup a segment definition by ID.
Overwrite a segment definition.
Delete a segment definition by ID.

item.description: A segment definition includes a Profile Query Language (PQL) statement that defines how to subdivide a customer base for an audience segment.

item.name: PQL conversions
Convert PQL formatting between pql/text and pql/json.
Segment jobs
Retrieve a list of all segment job requests.
Create a new segment job request.
Lookup a segment job request by ID.
Cancel or delete a segment job request by ID.

item.description: Segment jobs process previously established segment definitions against your profile store to generate an audience segment.

item.name: Previews
Create a new preview job.
Lookup the results of a preview job by ID.
Cancel or delete a preview job by ID.

item.description: Previews provide paginated lists of qualifying profiles for a segment definition.

item.name: Estimates
Lookup the results of an estimate job by ID.

item.description: Estimates provide statistical information on a segment definition, such as the projected audience size and confidence interval.

item.name: Projection configurations
Retrieve a list of edge projection configurations. The latest definitions are returned.
Create a new edge projection configuration.

request.description: The API response is immediate, but the actual changes to the projections on the edges take place asynchronously. There is no guarantee that changes to the definition of the projection are reflected instantly on the edges. It is best to assume that there is a noticeable amount of time between the update of the definition of the projection and the update of the actual projection on any edge.

item.name: Lookup an edge projection configuration by ID. The latest definition is returned.
Create or update an edge projection configuration by ID. Overwrites the entire configuration.

request.description: The API response is immediate, but the actual changes to the projections on the edges take place asynchronously. There is no guarantee that changes to the definition of the projection are reflected instantly on the edges. It is best to assume that there is a noticeable amount of time between the update of the definition of the projection and the update of the actual projection on any edge.

item.name: Delete an edge projection configuration by ID.

request.description: API response is immediate, but the actual changes to the projections on the edges take place asynchronously. Eventually, the result is that the profile data for the given customer will be wiped from all edges.

item.description: Edge projection configurations determine what data should be projected to each edge.

item.name: Projection destinations
Retrieve a list of edge projection destinations. The latest definitions are returned.
Create a new edge projection destination.

request.description: The API response is immediate, but the actual changes to the projections on the edges take place asynchronously. There is no guarantee that changes to the definition of the projection are reflected instantly on the edges. It is best to assume that there is a noticeable amount of time between the update of the definition of the projection and the update of the actual projection on any edge.

item.name: Lookup an edge projection destination by ID. The latest definition is returned.
Create or update an edge projection destination by ID. Overwrites the entire configuration.

request.description: The API response is immediate, but the actual changes to the projections on the edges take place asynchronously. There is no guarantee whatsoever that changes to the definition of the projection are reflected instantly on the edges – in fact, it's best to assume that there is a noticeable amount of time between the update of the definition of the projection and the update of the actual projection on any edge.

item.name: Delete an edge projection destination by ID.

request.description: API response is immediate, but the actual changes to the projections on the edges take place asynchronously. Eventually, the result is that the profile data for the given customer will be wiped from all edges.

item.description: Edge projection destinations define where to route a projection that has been created or changed.

item.name: Event types
Retrieve a list of event types.
Create a new event type.
Lookup an event type by ID.
Overwrite an event type by ID.
Update one or more attributes of an event type by ID.
Delete an event type by ID.

item.description: Event types are context descriptors for time series events within Real-time Customer Profile.

item.name: Macros
Retrieve a list of all macros for your organization.
Create a new macro.
Lookup a macro by ID.
Overwrite a macro by ID.
Update a macro by ID.
Delete a macro by ID.

item.description: Macros allow you to inject pre-computed fields and values into segment definitions. Values from different fields are added together and tested against the profile store as a single value. With macros, audience segments can be defined in more ways than would otherwise be available from isolated profile data fields.
